alert.note: Alert for Berks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 4:18PM EDT until July 07 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL BERKS COUNTY... At 418 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Reading, Wyomissing, Kutztown, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Lyons, Lenhartsville, Fairview Hgts, and Spring Ridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 34 and 37. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 9 and 11. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
